How will all these returns get done before 7? üôÑ  *** I was about to go on my break and this was supposed to be a rhetorical question. This is what get pushed aside and left for us in overnight to do ontop of everything in the store.

There was one night that I went in and wasn't feeling well and the assist mgr had asked in the meeting if anyone wanted to go on back home, no truck, nothing to do but zone. I told a co worker that I wouldn't mind going back home, taking meds and going back to bed. She went and found the assist mgr n told him what I had said, and he told her to watch the front end and have me find him, I did and he told me to hand my keys and walkie, and go on home. I did and about a week later the other assist mgr asked if I was there said night and I explained what had happened to her, and she said that I had been pointed for not being there, but she went in and fixed it.
I went home 2 hr.early is 1 point everything under 2 is half a point
2hrs
After lunch.
If your asm says you can leave early, it should not count against you at all.  He probably means you can use PTO to cover your pay because you wouldn't get paid for it.

So I have a question about critical need. I have a Doctor bill, they werent billing me for almost 6 years. Now its putting an extra stresser on my regular debt pool. Would the fund cover this, its about 1200. I am a 3rd shift worker, who do I go to. We have no Co's just assitant.

I do not think think they give that much I am not sure though..... we had somebody received $1,000 that's a lot of paperwork that you have to provide and it has to go through the proper channels... it might be a tad bit time-consuming.... I do know it's a Once per lifetime thing...store mngr is your contact according to our store mngr back then
I would ask my store right now. but because I am off the clock, this one manager insists on not letting me ask these questions. I  know a Co or Store has to approve or Deny
Critical need would be a "critical need". A doc bill is not a need. Electricity might be considered a need. Medication might be considered a need......if a doctors bill is the case, I gotta few......
I dont think it would cover the dr bill. It's for like rent, electric, etc.
That mngr is silly.... people who call in to ask personnel questions are off the clock also
P.s. They can't bill you after 7yrs....right?
She said they wasn't billing her for almost 6 years
Exactly, if she didn't pay for another year they drop it.
If it was me personally I wouldn't worry about it, but they was slick to send her the bill now to try to collect
Because they know it's about to fall off.....
They can take it out of your tax return if the send it over to a debit collector.... I had this happen to me this year and it was for a bill that was 9 years ago. That I had COMPLETELY forgot about.
10 years for medical...
I heard it's tough to even get approve for it
Call Allstate. They can tell you  what you can get the money for. 1-800-514-9525.

ü§ó
so your telling me. We hjave To risk loosing my apartment. all to pay down doctor bill. Okay I apply for new job tomorrow after work! FRIGGGIN CRazy... who else hates the insurance here too?

Is it in collections? Call whoever is billing you and see if you can set up a payment plan. If it's the hospital usually they payments can be really low, they just want to see that you are making an effort. If it's in collections the company will try to talk you into large payments but if you can set up auto pay they should be willing to do lower payments
Also if it's still at the hospital ask if they have a charity program that can help pay the bill, I know in my state that is an option
I think I would pay my rent before a doc bill.....

I went and talked to my hospital.  They have a program to help if you make so much....maybe you can get help that way. My bill was  1300 and I got help. That's before my surgery bill . Haven't gotten that one yet.
I pay on my doctor and hospital bills 25.00 a month. If they accept the payment every month  your good.
They will but they mean the world too me. I hate being in the Red to a organization that is helping me tremendously
Walmart is not gonna care about what something means to you. Decide how much you can pay and go from there.
I wasted my time off. I need to spend time applying for work other than walmart
Most dr offices/hospitals will take payments if you consistently put down a certain percentage

They'll give up to $1500 in your career, but unless they've changed it, they won't pay medical bills, but they'll help with your normal bills if you're having trouble with them due to paying a medical bill. A co manager would be able to tell you more about it. I've got it once and my husband has got it twice for smaller amounts. He never had any trouble getting approved, but I had to fight for mine. I think it just depends on how it's worded and who looks at it

I'm sure u will have to pay it . It's under the deductible amount. You have to pay your deductible before the ins pays anything. I just got done paying 3000 worth of medical bills and then dropped that Insurance like a bad habit.

Just work out a payment plan. A nedical bill isnt an "in need" thing. Only rent, utilities,  or if your place is destroyed say in a fire. Most jobs ive worked at won't help with medical bills. Do you have 401k? You can take a loan out. Payback is really good
might not open a can or worms...but check your states statute of limitations on medical bills...I know in my state there is one and they cannot bother you to pay it.
A doctor's bill is not a critical need! Seriously? If you were going to lose your house or had disconnected utilities, then you could apply. But not over a medical bill.
Please do not skip your rent to pay a medical bill. Like Rena Pearson said, pay a few dollars a month.
Seriously!!!!!!
The critical need is threw Allstate. I

Walmart said they mailed my w2 almost 4 weeks ago, I called to verify the address wich they said was correct.  I have yet to receive it. I cant get it online because I didnt know you had to consent to get it electronically since Ive been on maternity leave since dec22.
Are you planning on using a tax service? They can import the info without the paper form.
They're in violation of the law... it should have been in your hands by Jan 31st
But they have no control of the USPS, they just need proof it was mailed, right? :-(
No, tax laws says that it must be received by January 31st accept in extreme circumstances,  such as my having moved from my employers last known address
By this time it should have been returned for being mailed to the wrong address
Cantare Davunt Actually tax law is it must be POSTMARKED by January 31st. As Elizabeth Turner Marler said, employers have no control over the USPS>

And actually, even if you don't plan on using a online tax service, you could go ahead and start the process and access all the figures from there. Then you could get going and eventually you'll have the paper copy.

Yes, you are right about the mail... but it also says that they should have it in a reasonable amount of time after that... just because they mail it out doesn't mean they aren't responsible for making sure that an employee gets it. They can't say they mailed it and wash their hands of responsibility if it were to say, get lost in the mail... or delivered to the wrong address.
MN laws clearly states received  Jan. 31st,  but other states might not be so clear on when it should be mailed vs. received.
I always thought it was worded as "received" also...
By Jan. 31st so... by hand in store... no postal service exception is written here.
Has to be POSTMARKED  by Jan 31.
Call and ask for a replacement to be sent to you or ask them to send it to the store.

If you haven't received your W-2, follow these four steps: Contact your employer If you have not received your W-2, contact your employer to inquire if and when the W-2 was mailed. ... Contact the IRS If you do not receive your W-2 by February 14th, contact the IRS for assistance at 800-829-1040.

Neighborhood vs Super Center. Who has more of a work load?????? And Go.......
Why?
SuperCenter
I work at a supercenter overnights and we juat had a 3900 piece truck last night just on gm ... Idk about neighborhood ones but i know that is alottttt of freight lol
Supercenter
Supercenter by a mile.  The markets carry far fewer items and have less departments.
Has anyone worked in a neighborhood before ?
I do and it gets super busy because we are by a beach
Im a csm at neighborhood market
I've worked at Sam's, Supercenter and Neighborhood markets. Neighborhood markets for sure have the least workload.
We stay busy
I'm sure it's similar if you look at staffing at each place. Higher volume stores will be allotted more man hours. Evens the load.
Supercenter

It all depends on the area. I've worked at 7 different Walmart facilities and from my experience the smaller ones sometimes have it harder due to the fact that every time someone calls out the percentage of workforce missing is greater than at a store with more employees. For instance I worked at a small neighborhood market and most days we would only have maybe 4 people so if 2 people call out that's 50% of the workforce. Plus at that store we did so many sales that even though you could only fit 6 pallets in the back room , some days we would get 17 pallets . Also our milk cooler could only hold 5 pallets so with 3-4 pallets of vendor milk it was a challenge when you got 2-4 pallets of dairy.
Supercenter is harder!!! I'll do anything to go to a NHM store.  They're stores are more friendly with ekmoyees, happy to help attitudes and they're cross trained in pretty much everything.
Supercenter. Market is just grocery, and supercenter is grocery plus gm
Markets have GM too , supercenter has more though
Can't compare i have only worked at supercenter
Worked in both. Currently an overnight support at a NHM. Just depends on what position u have. I ran dairy at a super center and it was easy.
Supercenter but the NHM whine like they got a lot of freight...  smh. Like 3 pallets for dairy is alot....
I have 3,500 piece nights at a NHM with a crew of 5-6 most nights. Sometimes the fdd is 1500+. Try again üòâ
I only have one dairy person and one lead they have to do it all price changes section work recalls counts shelf availability etc.
And unload the truck and work the freight

I have only worked at a neighborhood market but I have two Supercenter not even in a ten mile radius. I have to talked to a bunch of people and the workload seems to be kinda even. There is way less people at a market and so the work load isn't that easy. I work overnights and we get the same size trucks as the super centers with the same number of people they have just in grocery. Not saying they markets do more. Just saying that that from where I'm at it seems equal.
NHM gets less freight, but we also have less people to work it. So when it comes to work load per person it's about the same.

I was cashier at super center and loved my job... Since October I have been at NHM, in produce and deli.... I now hate my job... The management at the super Center were so much nicer and easier to work with and for... It might be that I moved from country town to big city but I miss my old job and the people!

Sounds like to me that it's about the same work load for each. Also sounds like we all have the same problem with lazy ass people not doing their jobs making the work load 2-3 times what it should be for the rest of us.

Ok I know I complain alot here and yeah maybe I should just change companies but here it goes. I think the discount given to employees is a bunch of b/s! Should be 10% across the like EVERYONE else in retail or whatever the percentage is for any given company. But we don't get jack on food ! I spent $15 on food for dinner and not one penny came off. The everyday low price crap don't cut it either because Walmart is not that low a price on food. So how many folks believe the discount is fair? I think it should be across the board electronics garden tires and FOOD same percentage!

There are very few that actually appreciate what wal-mart gives them,  people tend to be very rude / disrespectful towards the company,  generally people just hate the company even if they do offer good things to them.  I Get people dislike the company but you work there, if you don't like it feel free to walk out the doors and find a better employer that will treat you far better

if you don't like the company, the door is always free to walk out and find a better employer,  i've worked for many companies and very few offered so many things such as wal-mart there is a reason many people stick it out with the company and that's because generally they are a good company to stay with

What they dont see is that most food is at a low markup so if u know ur business you'd see the reason why our company can not give discount on certain foods so please next time research before you vent
Walgreens has a 15%  discount across the board and 25% off of walgreens brand items
I think walmart should take a page out of there book
First wed have to markup up our product 100% more- easy to give that discount when your ripping customers every day
But the mark up on food is that high it's electronics and appliances that have a low margin
Maybe you should go scan, -- bag mu in 16-18% more in fdd and fresh
No, there is very little mark up on food due to competition.
They aren't required to give you any kind of discount but they do......

No they're not required  but any good business knows if you take off your people they'll take care of you and somewhere along the line wal mart forgot that. You know if you live in a state that has a sales tax that discount doesn't really tell you anything

What it comes down to is walmart knows no matter how many people leave they will always have 10 more at their door ready to take over that person's job, so the way I see it is they are being plenty nice by giving 10% off on certain things AND a bi-weekly paycheck so if people don't like that they are more than welcome to look for another business that will give them the whole world...... it's always what more is there for free and that becomes a problem for the store itself....

But that's the problem I shouldn't be lucky to have a job if I do a good job. The company should feel lucky to have an associate with their best interests at heart.  The threat of ten people waiting for my spot is ridiculous.  I think companies like walmart should do more for its people then ten percent hell you can't get a raise based on Merritt  just don't get fired and you'll get your 2% raise

And they more than likely are not going to change the way it's done anytime soon...... also no one is bigger than walmart, plain and simple and 10% is what you get if you want more look somewhere else

Walgreens, Kroger, Publix and Whole Paycheck are through the roof on their pricing for everything!
Exactly why the discounts are closer to Walmart only giving out 10% off than people will ever realize

I Remember that often if you didn't bring lunch you got gas station food,  even if you don't get 10% the money you save per day eating at wal-mart should be enough

Hayley Burke. It's on the Walmart App. You scan your Walmart receipts and if your local competitors have the items you bought at lower prices you get the difference back. You can have it sent to an eGift card which will be sent in an email. And you can scan the barcode at the register. Or you can have your $$ sent to a Bluebird card. David has not yet transferred his. You click on "Get it back" when you are ready to use your reward dollars. It takes 24 hrs for it to be loaded to your eGift card.

Do they let associates use recieving/deliver doors?

For what reason?  Just exiting and entering the store?  No. Even on Black Friday when we need to use an alternative entrance we use the double fire doors near the manager's office, because those are the ones closest to the lounge.
If youre a recieving manager u can use them to let vendors in

Right. Or I have taken McClain's totes out to the cage, or a cardboard bale, or a stack of pallets. As long as it's work related for one of the reasons I just listed or any other work related reason, then Yes.  But not for just regular exiting or entering at the beginning or end of a shift, or breaks.
I ordered a 50" tv and was hoping they would allow me to load it to my trunk
Just talk to your manager. In my store, we often allow people who purchase large items puck them up throgh the nearest emergency exit to S2S.
Yup. I've helped load some stuff into people's cars from those doors. Just have to ask.

I don't think it's ok for us to ask for that kind of special treatment. You're taking time away from the receiving associates' job or manager or whomever would have to stand at that door for you.  Just ask for a courtesy associate and maybe another male associate to do a team lift. Just like any other customer.

I wouldn't necessarily call it special treatment. We often let customers who order large items use alternate doors they can pull up to to load their items. But if that isn't typical in your store, maybe just ask for help with carryout.
I honestly don't think it's a big deal. It's really not much different than people asking to go out for compost. If I'm in the back, I'll gladly help.
Going out for compost is necessary, and work related.

Soooo... Tonight a lady comes in... Shes a THIEF!! And i hate thiefs!! So always wears the same sweatshirt so i know its her... Well i was getting ready to go to break as she walks by. So i let the cashier know who it was and i went and found the nearest CSM. who also knows that shes a thief.. She caught her last time. Well anyway she said to let the other cashier know when she xomes to self check to shut down the 2 farthest registers down (those are the ones she always goes to because she thinks we can't see her. Well AP was there and the CSM let him know about her. So he started watching her... As she came to self check out she made a V line for 44 and 45 (the farthest smallest registers we have) well AP was there watching and the CSM was also there watching the screen as she was scanning. You could tell she was nervous with all of us there üòÇüòÇüòÇüòÇ so she went to pay for her stuff and she tried putting Vday cards in her bag without scanning and the CSM caught that.. So she goes to leave and AP started to walk toward her and she froze and asked if she could leave her cart there for a second. The CSM said sure so she bent over quick and ditched a bumch of stuff she had on her. Then said she was going o Customer service. Walked around ditched some more stuff... Went to walk out with AP right behind her... She darted back in quick and dro]ed the rest of her crap by our pop display... It seems like she would have cought on because last time she came threw i turned off those 2 registers lol i dought she'll be back anytime soon... AP said next time shes in shes going to jail... No question... So Im pretty proud of myself for alerting and the CSM for helping me watch her and AP for scaring the shit out of her üëçüëçüëçüëçüëç‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

Good job!! I wish my SCO and cashiers were on it like you.  They always notify me after the fact once the people are gone and give me a receipt and I'm like WTF do you want me to do?  I love my front end!! Good job once again.

Right!! She wears the same thing everytime üòÇ
I mean, it's just logic. üòÇ
I love being part of AP!
Your AP sucks, how many next times did they give her? üòÇ

Way to go.

You guys do realize with people stealing underneath your nose and walking out the door it's taking it out of your own pocket that feed your family and the economy I think she would have went to jail if it was me
Well oviously i know this but im not AP...soooo...yeah
You definitely did the right thing not accusing her by instead stating they should watch her and then by not trying to stop her so kudos to that!
Wait for her to make transaction and out the door with it and to jail she goes
Its not theft until she walks out the door.until then there's nothing you can do but aggressive hospitality.
If she had already been caught once    ,why is she not banned from the store?
Because AP never seen her do it until last night. The other times he wasnt there.
good 4 u

If you don't mind a few points, and concepts, yes that is an old dinosaur, but it had twice the scanning light and programming of the MC series for several levels, meaning that with this old dinosaur I could scan UPC's on cardboard, I could scan even many bad labels that and MC will not scan.   OK, this is fixable with time, and upper level MC (quite a few levels)  Now, the Old dinosaur used Linux programming, which is the basis of all Global programming structure for Wal-Mart, and most banks world wide, while MC's work off of phone apps, which almost anyone can write, for there are programs to do this for you, and why is this of importance?  Simple all phone apps that I know of are hackable, while Linux in proper code is not, hackable except by some geniuses.   But, since the company wants us to switch, I except the challenge and hope for the best; for this all can be improved and the new apps I am seeing (but not tested properly before release) makes the future look real good!!!
Actually the MC is Windows CE. Just terminal servers into Linux smart system.

You will not believe what just happened.. I pulled into Walmart gas station to get a soda. When I walked up I noticed these two cops watching a woman who was smoking while gassing up.. I saw her and thought, "Is she stupid?!! With the cops right there too?!" But anyway, I went in n got my soda. As I was checking out, I heard someone screamin.. I looked outside n the woman's arm was on fire! She was swingin her arm and runnin around goin crazy! I ran outside and the cops had put her on the ground n were puttin the fire out with their coffees!! Then they put hand cuffs on her n threw her in the police car.. I was thinking "She shouldn't have been smoking and pumping gas!" But being the nosey person that I am, I asked the cops what they were arresting her for.. The cop looked me dead in my eyes and said ... "WAVING A FIREARM!"

So I have a question for all the HBA department managers. I'm trying to become the HBA DM for our HBA and I was just wondering if it is as difficult as I'm hearing? I have no experience with the DM position but I'm willing to learn. Thank you!

If all that's done correctly and by the assigned person then HBA is a breeze

I'm excited about the possible new job move but I just keep hearing how much it's a headache but my plan is to get it the way it's supposed to be
Going from a cashier to a DM position would be difficult no matter what department you went for. I would recommend trying for a sales floor associate position first
I have done that already so I know how to do it
Then I would go for it.  It's not hard at all as long as you follow routines and cap
I would say it's probably one of the easiest in the store

It is definitely a challenging department! I had a fantastic ASM who truly pushed for my success, and two other department managers who were really super showing me the ropes. It was VERY rewarding to see the results of all my efforts, and that drove me to make my department even better. If I were to be a dept mgr again, D2 would definitely be my first choice! Congrats!

You upload your pay stub, once it has been confirmed, you are given a spending limit, after you have ordered your product it will be shipped. The payments are automatically drafted out of your paycheck. It is a credited business through the BBB.

Today I was able to make an impact in a child's life. I miss being in the classroom but, my current employer pays me much more than ANY school district.  A little boy was in the toy aisle today and I was walking by and I stopped.  He looked at me and I looked at him, I then proceeded to walk down the aisle and say, "whatcha doing?" He knew he was caught! He was trying to steal a toy wrestler.  I soo blew my cover but I just had the need too because the world already sees black males as criminals anyway so I talked to him about stealing and how important it is not to steal. I told him I worked for Walmart and he replied, "where's your blue?" I told him don't worry about all that because I could have called the police on him if he was not 8 years old.  I then met his Mom and she had tears falling from her face she was furious.    Moral of the story: keep your kids with you in stores.    AP here..
Awesome job! Sometimes kids need a chance
I agree some kids do need a chance.   It felt good impacting and making a difference.  I miss my fourth graders though, so today was nice.
Good job!!! You have a big heart kudos for explaining to the child and not just charging him sometimes lessons can be learned without the worse case      Scenario
Yes, I just hope the Mom and the son didn't take it lightly.  I just didn't wanna stop him at the door & heck I couldn't even prosecute or put him in jail so I was like ahh what's the point?
Thank you for not participating in a day without immigrants. You made an impact in the kids life.

Lol, I got bills to pay. I can't afford any off days.  Immigrants (I don't know if they are or not) still came in, they still shopped and I got called to the service desk to translate for a man who didn't know English.
Awesome!!

When they are that young you are supposed to do everything  to keep from having to make the stop.  Sounds like u followed manual and hopefully he won't do it again

I can not confirm or deny the whole insulin and diabetes claims. As for high blood pressure and increased heart rates, from smoking to vaping my blood pressure and heart rate has come down to almost normal levels. I'm talking like 3-7 points away from normal. The whole claim that the fruity flavors are going to get kids hooked is a load of bologna. Alcohol has sweet/fruity flavors and kids still get ahold of it as easy as cigarettes and smokeless tobacco. Diacytle is mainly found in cake flavors and butter flavors. Even then, your looking at 1 part per million. To get any damage to the lungs it wltld have to be a constant exposure to the chemical. That being said the fda has strictly regulated the use of Diacytle. PG is a substance used in many places. It's 2 main uses are in antifreeze and hospital air systems. It's use in antifreeze is to make it less harmful if swallowed. And it'd use in hospitals is to sterilize the air. VG is used everywhere you go in life. It is made from vegetables and can be found on every piece of produce in and given store. It increases the shelf life of fresh fruits and veggies while not being toxic to the human body.  In summary, every claim in this post on what's IN e-cigs is inaccurate except for the part on diabetes. That all being said, not here bit ching at you, just asking you to talk to someone who vapes or a doctor and get the information from a creditable source.  I'm very proud in and of myself. Was addicted to cigarettes for 5-6 years and went over to e cigs. I'm now down to 0 nicotine but I still use it on a daily basis because my doctor and I have found it helps with chronic sickness. Than you for your time Kerry Senf O'Brien. If you want to talk or have any questions I could clear up for you. Just message me.  -DALE-
Thank you dale

As a person who vapes every single day, I have to say some of you are very ignorant. Vaping is definitely a healthy alternative to cigarettes, and if someone tells you differently, they are an idiot and you should not listen to them. Cigarettes have 4,000+ chemicals in them, most of which are your carcinogens. Reputable e-liquid, such as Madvapes, Kure, High Life, etc are held to certain standards and they do not place any unnecessary ingredients in their liquids. Common Vape liquids have about 5 ingredients, Propylene Glycol, or PG, Vegetable Glycerin, or VG, Nicotine, which is completely optional, flavoring, and some contain water. So, no, cigarettes are definitely way worse than vaping. Study your facts before you try to defend the tobacco industry, which I can promise you does not have your best interest in their mind.

I have to go to the Academy. I just found out, what exactly do you do there?
2 days or 5? I've been to the 5 day one. Im going back later for the job specific portion.
I'm going for a week.

It'll teach you how to be a supervisor. How to talk to associates, how to talk to customers. Teach the mc40s programs. Department modulars. One Best Way. And lots of group activities and role plays. I enjoyed it. But its stuff I taught myself beforehand. And almost none of it is job specific. It's as a whole. So CSMs, get almost nothing out of it. It's pretty much a supervisor class in general, that way if you transfer out, you already know what to do.

You also have to get an 80% on the assessment at the end I was told. They give you a couple of tries, but if you can't pass they'll force you into a non supervisor role. I haven't gone yet, but will be going in a few weeks. I'm still excited though.

If you fail, you come back to your store and you retake it every 10 days. I think you get 2 or 3 attempts. Out of the 100 that took it when I was there, only two failed. It's simple. Just double check your answers and don't glance at it. There are a few trick ones.
See the process of a store that got 100% on all processes and procedures. Like everything is perfect.
Wait so there is a test to this after we leave? I'm horrible at taking test.
It's 40 questions. Open book, open notes. You use ipads. So one iPad you can have the lesson, the other the test. It's not hard. It's only bad if you oveethink or stress.
So you can look for the answer. Do you have to go to college
It's for all level 6 and 7 associates, I've been told.  No. No college is needed I don't believe.
It's easy a lot of it you already know don't second guess yourself.

We have been told we can buy it when we are not on the clock, and as long as we didn't hide it so another customer couldn't get it.

That's the old policy...it isn't in force anymore. Pulled up the policy not too long ago...it has to be on the floor for purchase by all customers, u can't get something out of the back that has just gone on clearance, but u no longer have to wait 24hrs. as long as it is available to the public.   We had something similar happen @ our store recently, won't go into details but IT WAS NOT PRETTY!!!
I got wrote up for buying marked down product 6 years ago
in frozen was not out for 24 hours but had mgmnt approval
The rule where I work is that the person who marked it down cannot buy it for 24 hours
Yes that's always been a rule
Yes that includes seasonal items as well.
Been a rule for years the customers have to have first chancwe to but it.
What if you're not on the clock?
It's not really a RULE it's a POLICY.  But it's on. Store initiated clearance not home office.
yep
Just so u all know all of this is about to change when ur store put "the one best way " into affect!!! .....we have started this and we are a training store for it
Has been a policy since at least 2000.
This has always been policy they are just really starting to enforce it.
Always been the rule.....unless ur certain ppl
Ive been with walmart almost 4 years and never have heard that....
I think it only applies when you're the one marking it down. So if I Mark something down I have to wait 24 hours to purchase it and it has to be on the floor for that time
Only if it's store initiated. If it's a Home Office Mark Down you can buy it.
Right!
Nope
Been that way since I started in 97..

No. We just marked down some "hot" items, and both associates and customers were buying everything. Associates are customers too, plus we can't get an additional discount so it really doesn't matter who buys clearance items.
We shall see how it goes, especially after Halloween
The customer has to have access to the item first. Especially if its a markdown item.
Even if were off the clock we still have access to that item first so we cant buy it for a time.
I guess its enforced differentjy but still a rule for everyone.
The only  Walmart Policy  is if it's a store initiated Mark down the person that marked it down cannot purchase it for 24 hours.
Yes that's been like that for years
Nancy Heisler Melissa Marie Pipes Lauralynn Shearer
Yes

Its only on store initiated clearance. The person that marks it down can't buy it until the next day as it might raise integrity issues. However, home office markdowns are different and the general rule at our store on store initiated markdowns is on the first markdowns we can't buy it for 24 hrs, but if its been on the sales floor at a clearance price and it takes another hit we can buy it.
That's been the "rule"/policy since I started over 20 yrs ago!

message: I guess this is not good news for the stock...
Is this FAKE NEWS????!!!
no,  it was a business report
Yep not a joke
The nearly billion that Buffett sold off only amounted to about 27% of the stock he owns.
Any other stores have a crap ton on Valentine's left over? Hoping it's all gone today as it's 50% off.
We started putting the waster stuff up
Easter candy is up in mine. We maybe lucky to get 3 or 4 aisles of Easter merchandise set out tonight with this much valentines left over.
Midnight
It's 2:15am here.
We have quite a bit left. Ours goes to 50% off on the 15th.

Not ready for people bringing up regular candy and stating that it was on the reduced table. True that happens sometimes because people don't take back their regular candy when they see that there is some cheaper. But its still aggravatiing!
We got a new pallet of valentines in off of truck yesterday...
That's crazy
No comment
We don't have much left should be gone in the next day or so.

Us DM's were asked to clock in yesterday morning and head to Seasonal to zone and condense what was left. By the time I left work yesterday,  they had condensed the rest of Vday down from 6 aisles to three bringing the rest of Candy from the grocery seasonal aisle to fill.  The one thing I noticed that were left was the novelty candy and stuffed animals.  The chocolate was almost wiped out completely.
I just do the candy n I had bout 6sections left but by the time I left2day was down to 4
I had it down to the outside aisle yesterday, and zero plush left, got the stink eye from a woman who didn't believe I had no big teddy bears
Sold like 90% of mine
If folks had gotten thier taxes back sooner we wouldn't have so much left over.
True
We had three rows empty by 11 pm tonight lol
I went and bought my mom the stuffed Valentine's Dino, he was marked down for $14
I know most of its gone in 1117, because I worked the Valentine to Easter change over yesterday from 9 A.M. to 6 P..M. By 6 P. M. it was well on the way to complete Easter.
Is any one else's meat department joining cap and having the opener come in at 4am starting week 8
Just wondering if you've heard the same thing I did. I overheard that the csm can tell a cashier no to using the bathroom. I hope I'm not the only one who thinks that is the stupidest thing ever
They can say no if it becomes an excessive amount of times. But it can also be illegal if you don't allow someone to go. So it is a fine line.
Each case is different. Many seem to abuse it so it causes problems for others.

But what is an "excessive amount of times"? What if someone is pregnant or has a UTI, bladder, or kidney infection. Or any number of possible medical issues.  The answer is no. A CSM cannot deny a cashier a restroom break.
Those issues are taken in to account. 2 times in a 2 hour  period seems to be a lot especially needing to go 10 min after returning from a break.
I always have to go after my break. It doesnt ever hit me until after my break... so its unfair to assume that people should or did go on their break

Gregory Walter.. a csm is not a doctor.   Even if I was a cashier. I would not be asking their permission to go to the bathroom.  I'd shut off my light. Help the current customer I'm ringing out  then go. Whether or not the csm said yes or no.      They have no right to tell me whats excessive and what's not...   they have no clue if it's a medical condition  and technically has no right to ask of it is or not...

I have bladder spasms due to a bladder infection after surgery. When I have to go, I have to go or they'll be picking me up out of the floor. If I wet myself because someone thinks they know my body better than I do, all hell's going to break loose!

if you have a legitimate reason it is overlooked.  The thing is if it is medical then it should be reported period.  If it is constantly taking a 15 min break then going and you have no medical reason it becomes stealing time.  Every once in a while fine but everytime no.  You can actually be coached for stealing time.  Also yes the CSM should be made aware of medical issues because we are management and it does help to know this information.

I'll let them know but I'm not asking for permission. I have a weak bladder and I go when I have to go! Dr's note or not, they still will have something to say. So ill just finish up what I was doing and just go.
Jeremy Cupp Keefer well said.
Can't deny anyone the right to use the bathroom
My CSM tells me to hurry
Mine gives me 2 minutes...
I'd tell them to take that 2 minutes and shove it...  I'll take as long as needed.
Some times the line in the bathroom is so full it take 5 mins justto get a stall
I will tell them to make it quick if we are busy.  Usually the ones going at our store are using it to check their phones.
Would be a lot faster if you could make them leave their phones at register
Lol
If they tell me no...theyre gonna have a mess to clean up...I  just shut down and run!!!
No, they can't tell anyone they can't use the bathroom.
When i was a cashier i was told no a few times for a bathroom break
I would have gone over their head. Unless a cashier seemed to be abusing it, I would not say no. AND I would find out if there were a possible medical reason.
No.i just had to pee lol
You still should not have been told no
There will be a puddle .Maintanience .
And you can clean up your own puddle
And then you can go home since it would be their fault.
I have kidney stones on both sides and I have to drink all the time so I have to go a lot

I suffer from kidney stones also. am supposed to drink lots of water but I don.t because I can't depend on getting a break when I ask. I can only hold it so long before it's too late! The last episode of stones...both kidneys were full. VERY PAINFUL!!

Once I had a CSM try not to let me go to the bathroom (I am not a cashier). I don't go upfront anymore when they are there.   We have a co manager that watches the camera to see who goes in and out of the bathroom. And if they don't come in and out in a decent amount of time (for him) he goes to try and yell at them. He tried that once for me, I just told him that unless he's taking the dump to leave me alone.   He hasn't said another word to me since.   I help run 4 different departments. Don't need someone telling me I can't pee or shit.
My csm used to tell us we had to ask permission to go to the bathroom. Felt like I was back in kindagarden having to ask permission for everything
I don't think they can tell you no we are allowed to go
I usually don't care if the cashiers go to the restroom but they should at least tell me where they are at.
I've put in the code at the register and have been told "you go and take your break after that or not go at all" mind you... my break would have been 45 minutes early

I always let them go. & I have gone into the bathroom if they're taking an excessive amount of time. (10+ minutes) I have a couple cashiers that ask to go at least twice an hour. I'm sure they have a medical issue that needs attention  (they're older ladies so I know they aren't on the phone)
I am pretty sure it is the federal labor laws you can't deny someone of using the restroom

I'm a CSM and I let cashiers use the restroom all of the time. I just ask them to please hurry back. I know it might be an inconvenience to have them ask, but it's a lot easier to know where everyone is at.

Our cashiers put in the code to use the restroom.i always approve it unless it is self checkout or smokeshop register them o put in wait for replacement but ill cover so they can go or find someone to cover.i try to b quick but sometimes im busy and they have to wait a little bit
I do the same!! We need to know why your light is off for one and two to make sure you are goofing off around store
I do the same!

Action code.  If they don't have anyone in line, they can go and not wait for a response.  If they have a line, must wait.  A lot of them get a text message that they don't feel can wait so go to the bathroom to respond.
I would never leave my phone anywhere but my pants pocket period! Thank God I am not a cashier! You all go thru alot!
There very good on us using restroom.. Some of us are diabetics..
If they just got back from break or if we are really busy I have asked if they could wait a little bit, but I never just say no

I'm prone to kidney stones, think I have some now. Thankfully I rarely have to take an extra bathroom break. I can usually make it to my lunch break and then I go again after I clock out. Our csms never deny a bathroom break.

Okay so the whole time I worked for Walmart I was pregnant.  There was one time, and yes it was busy, but I was working self checkout.  I requested a bathroom break and AN HOUR AND A HALF LATER someone came.  GUYS, when a pregnant woman's gotta go she has to go!  You don't deny bathroom breaks to anyone!
I would have told csm I'm using the bathroom then just go
I would just shit my pants
My daughter is a cashier,she says she is only allowed on her breaks.
That is against labor laws!!

You are supposed to use your 15 minute breaks and lunch breaks for bathroom breaks.  I don't believe you can be denied a bathroom break.  However, you can be sent on your 15 minute or lunch early if a bathroom break is requested before hand.  And as a cashier, it is a must that a bathroom break is requested, so that the CSM's know where you are and/or can send a replacement to cover if it is necessary.
I don't ask I'm not a little kid I'm a grown man if I wanna go to the bathroom Ima go and I will still take my break
Let me just pee on spot and smell gross.... ummm no... I gotta go. Sorry.... but maybe this person abuses the system
They can't do that they are supposed to let you or replace you with someone so you can go

As an ex manager, it may sound dumb but sometimes that rule have to be enforced. When you have associates in the bathroom more than they are on the register, the whole store suffers. If you have a weak bladder, bring a Dr's note!
At that point it almost becomes time theft
Exactly! That's what it is! It was reported that one cashier was going in to listen to her audio book.
I thought Walmart doesn't accept doctors notes though. üòï
Angel Pybas they accept them for medical reasons in which you need accommodations, not for being sick and missing a day.
We have a great csm team, very understanding about needing to use the restroom, especially during certain times of the month ;) No one abuses it at my store
That's a basic human right, you can't violate that. However if you are misusing your trips to the restroom that is completely different.
The look on a cashiers face when you are joking around and deny it is priceless
It makes my day a little better honestly
lol I would go anyways
It doesn't take long to figure out which ones abuse it.  When u see them with their phone out before they even get to the service desk are the ones who will be in a long time

Matt Richardson They usually do.  Or they send the request and don't even pay attention to what the screen says.  The only reason I ever denied it and meant it is when I already have one on a 'bathroom ' break and need to wait for them to come back
What has happened to respect for the individual

Try being the only overnight csm and all your front end help has been taken to other parts of the store.  You are the only one left so you have to run a register and try to do things by yourself.  Then you have to go potty and your calling for the support manager on the radio. Now, by this time the morning crew has been coming in and they all have their own radios.  The support manager was to lazy to come see what i needed so over the radio i had to say i needed to go to the bathroom.  I heard me echo all over the store from the other radios.  I was so embarrassed, but at least she came quick and i barely made it in time. I swore next time i would pee my pants, go home and let them clean up the mess. lol
That's is complete b.s! This is why I'm about done with Walmart you can't tell someone they can't go to the bathroom!

Just to clear the air I have never denied a bathroom break. I have delayed them so as to not have empty right steer when we have customers. Hard to run the front end when 3 cashiers all wan to go at the same time.
There may be a reason why the CSM said no. I have never told someone no (I am a CSM) but I have asked them to wait until I have a cashier to send to them

When i worked o/n as a csm I always had a register set up for me for just such reasons.  Sometimes there is no time to wait.  So i would open my register and tell them to go.  I mean it's not like they were gone a long time;
That's illegal
One reason why I'm not a cashier. If I have to go I'm going especially since as you age, you go more.

Technically it's not! The law states that we give associates reasonsble accommodations for the restroom unless there is a medical problem. Most associates have 2 breaks and a lunch, that's a reasonable time frame!
If you half to go to bathroom it is against walmart policy to deny you that

No it's not. Like I said, we checked the law ourselves. Call the labor board, they will confirm it! Ask them if associates are allowed to bounce to the bathroom whenever they get good and ready. Let me know what they say!
In our state it can't be denied outside even outside of break and meal periods
Interesting.... Here in NC, it can be, and I'm glad!
Not illegal.  Just not nice.

So i guess in a 9 hour period you better only have to go three times a day and you better make sure all three times when your bladder is full is on a break or lunch lol i guess we can controll our body functions now

Periods, urinary problems and bowel problems can be serious. I know of a girl, who was denied a break to go to the bathroom because of her monthly. The person over the area, refused to give her a break. She had to go home, take a shower and come back to work. That's messed up! Someone would be in big trouble. I don't play around with my body or my job.
Let a csm tell me no I'm turning my light off and going anyways lol.

They told me I needed a doctors note because I go to the bathroom too much. I used to go maybe twice a day in the morning and after lunch, now I just suffer until my breaks cause if I put in to go they say something to be about it and have actually publicly said to me (in front of other workers and customers and LOUDLY) to go before I get on the register. To which I angrily answered I already did. I mean honestly where is the respect?

even though im not a cashier i do work for wal mart 21 year associate, i only have one kidney so i have to go more frequently than a lot of people do. sometimes people do have a good excuse for going frequently.
That is not right. I don't do that and I would hope other csms don't either. If I have suspicions about texting or using phones, count to 10 and follow them into bathroom.
Shit I've seen cashiers at my store talk on their cell while 31st the register so not being able to go to the restroom ain't gonna stop them.....üò°üò°üò°üò°
Half the time, our CSMs tell us we don't need to ask, just go. I just ask so they know where I am.
Or we just go and let someone on a register nearby know where we are going. Sometimes CSM's are too busy and you've gotta go. Lol
Support Heather told me to quit asking (as long as there's no line of customers).. üòÇüòÇ
I love her üòÇ
Same. ‚ù§‚ù§‚ù§
But other times, like with Alice, they get told no
Ive been denied a restroom break and was an hourbafter i was suppose to be off. My csms normally dont just say no unless there a logical reasoning for it
That's against policy and you need to report it to an ASM or higher
IM GONNA GO WHEN I HAVE TO!!!! otherwise there's gonna. E a big mess...üò≥ that's so ridiculous!!!

I let my cashier's use the restroom if they have to go. It is right in front of the registers anyways. A quick in and out is fine. I even would take over for them if they were in the middle of a trans if it was an emergency.
U can also walk off, what they gun do fire you for pissing,  yeahhh ok, ppl.need to stop letting wal mart scare them

In Ontario we can only take a bathroom break if there is no customers or if they have someone to switch off with you and we must use an action code and wait for a response courtesy sucks cause they say no every time unless they are there getting change
Ours have done it before, I've been told myself I should go when I go on break
as a csm, as long as they arent abandoning a customer in the middle of a transaction, cashiers can go whenever they want. We're adults, you don't need someone to tell you when to use the restroom
Like I said.. I only ask/ tell them so they know where I am. I don't like just walking off the floor.
Anytime a cashier needs to use the restroom i step right in and take over ringing it sucks when your busy and the only csm but come on now!
It would not be in her best interest. If I wet myself I am going home
if you work SCO you can't turn your light off and just go. It's wrong to let someone suffer until they can go!
and half the time, when you call a CSM, they can't get to you right away. Or get someone to cover you. I always go on my breaks. Even if my bladder isn't very full at all.

Walmart makes so much money that you would think they can afford to keep their staff. But customers want it now. They don't want to wait on someone to come cut their fabric. Source: I know the guy working on this new project. It's not designed to replace anyone, they still need associates to work the department. The customer can now get fabric cut when someone's not available to help. Ideas and suggestions are welcome :)

I think it's a great idea. I'm sure there will be a lot of customers needing help to figure it out. Nobody's job will be taken away. It will be just like the self serve kiosks in photo. Some will read the instructions and help themselves, and some will be too lazy and want associates to do it for them. The good thing is you won't have to hunt down a Talxon and printer. It will save time for those of us who have to come from another department to cut fabric. I have had to stand there for an hour cutting fabric while the customers in my department wait unassisted.
Exactly. I appreciate the comment, Laurie Menna Ezrow. We're always looking for new ways to make you and fellow associate's jobs easier. Thanks so much :)

Base for co is $10.50.
everyone at my store starts at $12
Ok. Ty

I wish some mangers could see what they do to their teams. Sorry I have to rant for a moment. But I see it a lot and not just in this company but many companies. You can't treat your team bad you can't put all the blame on your team it just doesn't work that way! I'm not in any manger spot myself but if I was I tell everyone I believe in two key words: 1) teamwork 2) communication. With these two things I believe many of your issues could be solved! We are a team it's not one specific persons fault and no one should just not take responsibility for the actions in your area. We all should be communicating and having a great knowledge about what's going on on the other shifts. If you are communicating with your team will help you know issues going on and help you solve them and make sure you can guide them with the right knowledge to do the job right the next time but instead putting blame on them is not the right answer. Guide them and build them up and you'll get the best out of them.
I absolutely love what you just said and I agree with you 100%
Thank you! One day I hope o can get into the manger spot and run a team how I think they should be ran and make sure they get treated right

You are welcome and I know the feeling I want to get into management so that I can give people the kind of manager that I have always wanted but can't seem to find. Right now I work in the Deli at a Neighborhood Market in Joplin Mo

Does anyone know if we can take a personal loan from our 401k ? If so can you tell how would I go about doing that and what are the requirements for it

GENERAL PURPOSE LOANS A general purpose loan allows you to borrow money from your retirement savings for any purpose. You pay a reasonably low rate of interest that has been set by your plan, often only a point or two over the prime rate. Repayment Frequency: Bi-Weekly Loan Duration: 12 to 60 Months Loan(s) Available:1  START A GENERAL PURPOSE LOAN RESIDENTIAL LOANS A residential loan allows you to borrow money from your retirement savings for acquiring your principal residence. Repayment Frequency: Bi-Weekly Loan Duration: 12 to 180 Months Loan(s) Available:1
Do you know how much I can borrow  and who do I contact in regards to me borrowing from my 401k Tom Greenfield ?
50 % of your balance at 4.75 % interest rate ..https://www.benefits.ml.com   Merrill lynch
Thank you Tom Greenfield!
If you login to benefits online click on loans it will show you how much you can borrow.
On the wire?
yeah, check the money section of the wire, money for the future. WIll show your 401k info and has link to Merril Lynch.

I did a loan from my 401k, got 2k, the interest isn't horrible. I pay back 20 bucks from each paycheck until paid in full. Not a bad deal if your in a tight spot. The repayment at 20 per paycheck for that amount isn't breaking the bank either. I'll probably throw in some bigger chunks to payback, not this bonus, but next ones coming, to pay off sooner and save on interest. The good thing is as it's just a loan from it, I believe the 401k keeps growing as you are still paying back (I hope anyway, gotta check that).
You can't send them extra payments. Only the remaining amount of loan will they accept.
ah, I did not know that, thanks

We have a cashier who is from Costa Rica, but has spent her life here. She is a wonderful lady, but she gets targeted sometimes.  (We are a central PA store)  A CSM actually told a customer to leave once because of the way they were verbally attacking her.

Don't feel bad we had a customer refuse help from the ladies in electronics so they called for a CSM.  I go back and they tell me that he said he needed a man's help.  So I walk over and ask him what he needed.  He then says "I need a real American man not a foreign fag man"...... I was like are you serious right now.  So I told him he can either except my help or the ladies help that was all he had at that time.  He said a few more derogatory remarks toward me so I had him escorted out.
Foreign...Fag..Man....?!? Wow, I would of done the same thing.. Except I would of said  " they don't pay me that well here dude, just get out!" And I would of walked away.
Trust me crossed my mind lol.  I normally laugh it off later but that was one time I couldn't.  I really wanted to meet him in the parking lot he had my blood boiling.

Back in 95 when I first started...I had a price check problem with this dude..So I had a csm come over...He kept complaining..So I looked at the csm and said " I'm going to the restroom, and getting a drink of water..And left...When I came back he was STILL bitching...And looked at me and said " I should take you outside and beat your smart ass" I said " and what will that solve, you're still not getting your way..Now have a good day..!
I like how you handled that.  Sometimes I do want to let some of my frustration out though lol.
I didn't use one single cuss words..I spoke my mind in a different way, that they didn't like...So I won that battle.. Haha. I refuse to be a human dart board for your ridiculous comments. Haha
When I make a customer leave I usually tell them we are paid to help them not be abused by them.  I am also known for telling them to watch their language because they are in a family store.

Mhhm .. same thing here. This dude wanted to return something he bought three years ago..Are you kidding me..Is what I told him... He still had the receipt. .BIG DEAL...Then he let the words fly...And I said to him point blank.." listen it's a three MONTH return policy..Not whenever it dies on ya. ..And as far as your language... No one wants to hear it...So you can leave sir
I got so many stories in 23 years.. I could write a novel.... Haha
I am the no CSM at work so most the customers hate seeing me walk over.

Lots of wanna be scammers won't go through my line, and choose to pick on older help, and newbies...Very wise choice on their part..Haha. I always have a great day at work...Just becuz of my demeanor, and to put it Frank.. I don't give a F*** , just give me your money, get your shit and get out.." haha ...That attitude is in a very good way of thinking also..

Question. Something came up in my personal life that will conflict with work and I need to call off tomorrow. Will my image be affected if I put "none" as my reasoning in the WIRE, or should I play it safe and just say Illness/Injury?
I would do other
I always say other even if I'm sick I always feel it is none of their business why I'm not there
They can't ask you why you call off.
I ways choose other unless it serious
There's really no reason to tell them why, unless it can be approved, since the point is decided by them inthe end when they work the exception, not based on the IVR input
Illness/Injury and Other are both unexcused absences, so it really does matter

Yesterday I reported an absence for today. Is it normal for my scheduled hours to still appear on the Wire? And is there a way to make sure my absence was counted without contacting my store?

Your scheduled hours will still appear.  There isn't really a way to be sure the absence was counted without contacting the store, but keep the reference number you got.  If there is an issue, that is proof that you "called in."
Thank you
np
Use your call in confirmation number
When you go to work, you can check on the GTO portal (system used for PTO).  There's an area that logs call-ins.
Question- if taxes are approved and says on irs deposit is feb 15. When will funds be in bank?
Feb 15

If you are getting EIC or child tax credit they are being held until after the 15th. Does it actually say it will be deposited on the 15th. I know on mine for where's my refund it says check back after the 15th
Mine says the same as Sarah O'Neal
No they will not be deposited that day... I have called they are saying that funds most likely wont be available  from your bank untill Feb 27th..
I just filed mine last week. Got my refund today.

Or eic
No, my kids are all grown and I didn't qualify for any of that. Still, I filed exactly a week ago today. NEVER dreamed I'd get it that quick. It was a very pleasant surprise!

If you don't have EIC for a child than you'll probably get them back tomorrow or soon... everybody that hasn't claimed a kid that i personally know already has theirs back on the date it said it was coming we will find out also tomorrow my boyfriends says his will also be back tomorrow but he didn't claim any kids though.

However depending on your return you may not see any money u till the week of the 27th.. When i check mine is says check back on Feb 15th... If you got a tax credit..  However if you did not get a tax credit your return should be back to you in the normal amount of time.. My mother and brother did not get a tax credit. And they have both received their money...  After the 15th you can check back and have morw information

It says to check back on the 15th.  But it changes every 24hrs.. So u only need to check it once

So if a manager said they were going to give you a coaching for success instead of a actual coaching and turn around and give you a coaching. Can something be done? Also, how long can management wait to coach you if it happened last week?
They call a coaching coaching for improvement or maybe success now
I was going to say the same thing it is considered a coaching for success.
I got a coaching in Jan for something that happened in Sept for something that I didn't do so they had to take the coaching away cuz there was proof I did nothing wrong and they messed up
They changed the wording to make it sound more positive
But it stays on your record for a year so I dont think either way u want one
Since they love to give coachings, maybe they should make it a max of 6, and they should drop off in 6 months. üòÇüòê
I thought a coaching and a coaching for success were 2 different things. I thought the coaching for success was right under the coaching..
No it's only one thing a write up.
A coaching for success is on the floor, help you better yourself. Teach you things. Coaching for improvement is the one in the office. That is the "bad" one. It's if the coaching for success failed.
I got that. But if a manager has already talked with you about something. They can't turn around and coach you for it a week later right?
If they have had a personal talk with you about it. And u did same thing yes they can couch u.
No... it does not look like a Walmart... at all.
Walgreens..... but I wish I could put these in my otc area.

Only if whatever they taught you, you failed to understand. Us we only coach people if they really don't do their job. So I don't know the circumstance for this one. The only thing would be if you failed to do whatever that success coaching was about. If they coached you and then never followed up to make sure you understood, that's on them. Not on you. The academy told me "just because you tell someone what to do, doesn't mean they know how to do it." So if it's that case, I'd bring it up to someone higher on the chain of command. Some stores like to break policy and abuse power. Mine does that shit in a heartbeat. If something is unjust, never be afraid of open door policy.
This is true... my store just like to make rules up as they go and say it's policy and expect you not to challenge it

Regardless of whether this coaching is justified, I just wanted to answer the second part of your question. Can they wait a week? Yes. I've heard of coachings being done a month after whatever happened. But that's usually because an investigation needed to be done.  But the point is, yes, they are allowed to take time to "get their ducks in a row" before doing any coaching.
Thank you..
You're welcome

You still need to call in every day you are scheduled till you are approved

What kinda credit score you have to have to get a Walmart credit card and are you allowed to have anything in collections
I don't know but I was approved for $75.00 credit limit
There are better options I promise.  What's your current score?
You could always apply and see what you get
No. You need ALMOST A1 credit. I got approved for discover and American Express before walmart.

My husband was approved with a 680 credit score for $2,000. It takes income into account too. Having something in collections might hurt you, but I've been approved for a credit card with good credit and a medical bill in collections before.
I got one with a 500 limit and my cs is 597

This card is buried in my lock box.  I use Amex for virtually everything for travel rewards.  I got a $6000 honeymoon for $45.  It would take 3 years of nearly maxed out MyShare bonus to make that happen!
I have a capital one credit card but caint get approved for a Walmart one and I have almost good credit
Didn't had credit and got Walmart credit card

I have poor credit and got a card. It's not a high balance. I applied when I knew I would be using the 6 months 0% financing for my purchase, I figured what could it hurt!  I was surprised I was approved!

If you have debt in collections they probably won't give you one. The only real way to know is to run the application. Just be careful, all store cards have very high interest rates and if you don't pay off within the promotional period, you'll get hit pretty hard. If you have debts in collections probably not a great idea to get another card. You can do as you wish of course, I know its hard to get by when in debt but another card will just add to the problem. There are other solutions. Been there. Just hate to see others make same mistakes I did.

34,000 + members, all of us WM people have a story or two.  Tell them, they're funny. Here's one of mine:  many yrs ago I'm checking bullpen, only lane open about 2:30 AM.  Young lady about 25 comes thru line, alone, dressed as if she is in night-time entertainment(if you catch my meaning) Ph this is a very small town, laid back n rural. Lady's purchase nothing unusual, a drink, some HBA, maybe some cosmetics, the usual.  Nighttime backroom associate D** come up behind her with his lunch, a triangle sandwich and a monster.  He's a great guy, we are good friends, he's friendly and still works here, he's a gr andpa, but sometimes he's a little slow mentally.  So I total the lady's purchase, 26-27 $ and she gives me all ones, neatly creased.  So as I'm recounting her bills D** looks over, smiles at her and says "must be a waitress."  At this point she hesitates and says "Well......kind of."  At this point I look up and catch D*** eyes and wink and slightly grin". Then he starts to really smile , he now gets it, 24 -25and your receipt and 36 cents changethank you."  She politely gets her change and bag and heads to the door, and as she exits me and D**+are having a good ha -ha and he's looking a bit embarrassed!

colognes(not samples)!

It is actually stated in policy that we do unless it has changed in the last couple of months. But we all know Store manager has final say in everything!!

I am HBA DM. I was told by AP that when a customer sprays stuff like Axe on themselves and put it back that I can bring it to them and tell them to purchase or I can have a manager contact the police for theft. I never catch customers doing it, but I once saw an associate do it. It's not worth losing your job, because you forgot deodorant.
This is a customer. I think he should be confronted!
Management or ap must confront them...  ap-09 policy...  no other associate can or face termination...

I need to see how something mixes with my skin before investing in any new products. If theyre in there everyday before work or something I understand your frustration but this seems...a bit much to me
they are in there EVERY SINGLE DAY, no joke!
Sugar honey ice tea , thats a LOT! There are groups that will provide those in need basic stuff....that would make me really mad too
I have learned to control my expressions when the customer hands you a bag of pits and stems and tells me how great the cherries were!!
I would go over and grab about 4 lbs and make them pay! if they get ugly tell them the need to talk to AP to get to the bottom of why they are brining up pits and stems!
Take the ap09 cbl and you'll understand
I have! And I still see it as stealing. At my other job he would be stopped!
It is stealing. But according to the company it isn't. So there's nothing to do but aggressive hospitality
Katlynn Smith, it just infuriates me. I come from a store in which our bonuses were 550+ and I come here and its 80+ because of things like this that management allows! Smh
The store I'm in now is low volume and high shrink. We have our regulars. It's terrible and I hate it. But I have to follow the policies
At least you get one... I've been at my store since 4/09/16 and have never gotten a bonus because we always lose them....

So you want to confront a person for spraying Axe body spray?  A $3 item where they consumed maybe 1/100 of the product.  So about 3 cents worth of product. A product that the next person won't even be able to tell the difference.  The average Walmart customer spends $2,400 per year.  You want to give up $2,400 per year over 3 cents of body spray?  When I was a Store Manager I came across the same line of thinking from APAs and APMs pretty frequently.  My response was always go catch the guy stealing 3 TVs at a time and leave my customers alone. The people wrapped up in the petty are typically the ones that are not capable of catching the thieves that really hurt the business.

Where did Axe spray come from? It's actually Nautica cologne. Also, if someone helped themselves EVERYDAY to things like this, I'm pretty sure they would steal other things if given the chance. So we only need to care about the large items? Wow.
P. S. This man is in EVERY DAY and buys absolutely nothing! He only helps himself to the colognes. We would not lose anything on this man, we would only gain!!!
Sounds like you have a personal problem with him beyond spraying a little cologne.
No, don't even know the man. Only thing I know is that he needs to be stopped.
Are you a APA?
Mike Manila, if I was APA at this store, I wouldn't have to come here and vent!

Fill a few outs and give friendly customer service.  It will offset the harm the cologne bandit is doing ten fold.  Don't sweat the small stuff. It will drive you crazy.  Now go out there and enjoy your day.  Be thankful you above a few free sprays of cologne.
Thanks Mike Manila, I'm having a great day today! I'm home!

My favorites are the ones who eat half a bag of grapes or bananas.  I always go get the biggest replacement I can find to ring up.  I can't stand a theif no matter if it is big or small.  A theif is a theif no matter.  I don't understand anyone saying it is only blah blah blah.  If they came in your house and did it I bet it would be a different story.
Exactly!!! And like I said, I'm pretty sure they are taking big things as well!
It's dishonesty either way, yes. But, Mike is looking at it from a business perspective, not a moral one. This wouldn't be the only time WalMart made an immoral business decision.
Ok
I totally get that but in my opinion management not having better morals is a big part of the problem with walmart.
Can't argue with that. Also, if people aren't stopped when they are stealing little, then they start stealing big.
Theifs remind me of two year olds they start small to test the water and see what they can get away with.  If you don't tell them no on the small things it just gets worse.

I tried searching and did not see what I was looking for. Forgive me if it's been asked before lol. I know how we hate that. Anyways, I know how sick pay works now. Here's my question, can I use it on days I wasn't scheduled? Hours were cut (yall know) my assistant did tell us to just override and work our normal schedule which I  would have the last 3 days if I wasn't in and out of the hospital with my 1 year old. Also do they require documentation to give the sick pay? That's it for now lol.
Yes you can use it to make for hours you aren't scheduled
Are you talking sicktime hours you had before the new system? Or, are you in a state that has six time by law?

I know you can touch the old sick time until you use up whatever pto you have (I only have a few hours) so I was hoping to use those up and then some of the sick. I know once it's gone, it's gone but that's what it's there for right?
Depends on your state laws. Most of us can only use it to take care of a sick family member, not on ourselves. :-(

Yeah at my store says you can't use it for yourself (dumb) but it wouldn't be for myself it would be for my 1 year old. I'm just not sure if they require documentation to approve it or not. That's her in my profile pic.

okay cool , I wasn't scheduled all week actually. But I was just going for the last 3 days. Attempting to work the next two, hoping for no further emergency visits with my daughter. BTW I like your profile pic Josh R Solet
Thanks. Lol
You can use your pto to get up to 40 hrs in a week. Pto and hours worked cannot exceed 40 hours in a week

So I have a question, I have a co worker that swears one of the co managers is out to get her. She has 2 write ups already and she is wanting to open door him and she wants a transfer, so how does she go about doing both? Or would it just be better for her to just try and transfer? Or can she even transfer?
Usually with active coaching you can't transfer but sometimes they will let you,  depending on new stores manager.  She needs to talk to HR and go from there
One Coaching you can 2 coachings you cant
Up to your store manager and the store manager you want to go to.  Acceptions can be made.  Open door - go to your store manager since it is a co that the issue is with.
Go to another store manager, she can try to fight the coachings as well. She can also call the ethics hotline.

We have just gone through our sexual harassment acknowledgement. However also the pathways tell us what to do if you feel you are being singled out etc. You can go to another department manager and tell them. Go up the path of chain of command. Then go to Ethics holine as mentioned

Do not go to another dept manager.  Tell your co worker to go the store manager since it is a co manager she thinks is the issue.  Open door is with the next level of salaried management. Do not tell her to go to a dept. manager unless she wants everyone to know her business.

Walmart trained, and I worked as a medication technician for an assisted living facility. Anybody working for Walmart pharmacy be they a cashier, otc sales associate, or department manager has to register with their state board of pharmacy. After passing the background check You'll automatically receive your pharmacy technician license. If you ever want to be a certified technician Walmart will pay for the test. You just have to complete a few courses on the wire first.
