story: John Barbour shared SUN T-Shirt - Awesome Tees's photo to the group: Wal*Mart Associates.

message: Has management in your store discussed the new scheduling policy that is going into effect in the near future?  I understand that the goal is for all associates to have open availability.
Nope. I gave them open availability when I started. They abused that privilige and I shut down my schedule. I will NOT open it back up just for them to abuse it again without the proper pay!
The same thing happened to me!
Worked every weekend in Claims for 5 years. Tried atleast 3 times for a Claims position but kept getting denied. So I stopped the weekend work.
I will not re open my avalability either
I can't have open availability...
It's my understanding if you want hours you need open availability
That's what we were told.
We haven't  been told anything yet, but I know it's coming I'm personnel.  Just wish they didn't keep everything so secretive
Not totally true. It has a little affect on it but not a ton.
That is stupid, we each have obligations in our lives that have priority. We work retail for the flexible schedule to meet their needs and our own.
I totally agree!
One was told they were selfish for not opening up theirs.
I agree. Walmart has been amazing up until this started as far as my changing schedule every semester but now it's crap. If I wasn't so close to graduating with my degree I would quit.
I have open availability been open since 2003. The last 4 weeks my schedules were 36, 38.5. This week 35 next week 34 week after

Already started it here. I have open availability been going on 28-34 hrs a week since christmas was getting 35 a week after thabksgiving. Finally next week im getting hours back. But its hard i got three kids and now im paying even more for childcare just so i can work
I can't have open a availability,  due to being on disability and only able to work a certain amount of hours per week
I understand. I have health issues, too.
I am on disability as well. They knew this even before I was even offered a job. They most of the time over schedule me getting to many hours forcing me to lose my check for the month
Have you ever hear of the Bypass program.

It's a either you comply or get no hours....sorry but it's not about you it's about customers any other company would not hire you or say thank you but your services are no longer needed .... I've been in retail for over 35 years and Walmart is the only company who does this just saying

Walmart get a kick back to hire people with disability's so that don't seem right.And for the other there is a lot of workers who they tell you won't get your hours if your availability isn't open well they get there hours and straight 7 to 4 off weekends,when others are told to be open and the ones with restrictions get what they want and the ones with open availability get shafted.

All I am saying Walmart is the only company who has this all the others could care less and it includes working for the government.......and that is management because my employees are highly respected by open availability the one with close do not get hours period
You can always opt in to open spaces if you need more hours.
Even with complete open availability they still screw you over. Dropped to only 3 days and quit. Good luck.
Several associates said they got called in the office and told to sign a paper opening up availability or no hours.
Haven't heard alot about it
What does open availability mean?
Available 24/7
I'm just waiting to see what happens.  I work in soft lines and few of us have open availability.

Too many people are not fair. Only available when they want to work....I think it should be that way....unless people have class or another job. If people aren't available when the shifts fall, hire people that are.
i doubt 80 people would get fired for availability, and if they hired you under certain terms they can't change/ modify the terms of employment down the road

We've been on it for awhile now and even those with open availability have had their hours cut drastically. It usually goes back to normal this time of year but I guess they are cutting everyone's hours. We're so short handed it's crazy. It's not even bc of call ins but there's just not enough people scheduled
I have had open availability since 1996, my worry is I'm grandfathered in to full time at 28. I can't live on 28 hours
Correct me if I am wrong but isn't the grandfathered thing non existent ?
Those that are grandfathered in stay grandfathered but no one is able to become grandfathered anymore.
I thought a lot of the grandfathered stuff got dropped last year..i got the pay out of Sunday pay and stuff like that.
Were you maxed out? That doesn't have to do with being grandfathered. If you were maxed they give you a lump sum
No they use to pay you more to work Sunday and the folks that were getting that got a one time pay out which is different from the lump sum pay out which happens each year.

I would never change my availability. If I'm not available for reasons I'm not going to all of a sudden become available because they need people here or there even when they wanted an earlier start I 100% said i was hired under these conditions with these hours no dice

I have always had open availability and now I work Tuesday thru Saturday 530am to 230pm. I understand we all have lives outside of work but people need to remember that we work retail and the needs of the customers out-weigh the needs of the associate's
Well I don't have open availability due to bus schedule but I bust my ass when I'm there. If this new scheduling thing takes my full time away I will have to look elsewhere for work.

We are going to have to wait and see how this affects our front end. They should take into consideration the reasons why some have changed their availability, some people can't make it to work for certain hours

The needs of the customer should not break the back of the associate!   I don't feel it's the customer's need as much as it is greed.  If that were so, we'd have associates on the floor and not all on register. We're asked to do more work with less people at a rate that isn't livable.  Yes, tell the world that we're raising the wage to $10, but neglect to tell that the hours will be cut.  So I'm choosing when to be available.  Walmart isn't like it was 20 years ago when the stores weren't 24 hours and families mattered.
Not to mention those of us who have been there for hears are making the sane pay as the ones who have been there for 6months
Yes you need open availability or you get little hours maybe 10 if your lucky it's already at my store it Sucks big time
Mine won't change. Never will (mod team)

I think it's already started at my store, 2386, cause I can only work between 9am-10pm on weekdays cause I got to put my brother and sister on the bus and I only got 14 hours on my new schedule...it's crap cause I got student loans to pay and I'm barely making enough to pay those let alone my other bills...
I keep hearing about it but we have never had a discussion with management about it...heard it's happening in April
I have open availability except for sundays for religious reasons and they still cut my hours...

You don't matter.   Your family don't. Matter.  Its wal-mart.  You just do it or go home.  Me.  I'm going home. .  Soon.  27 years.  Enough.  Thank God I got heavy In stock and 401k.  Ready to finally live and enjoy life.  Good luck. New people.  Not what Sam Walton WANTED.  It all died with him. So Sad..
Walmart will eliminate around 275,000 associates when this goes into effect. Around 80 per store. Replaced with part time associates.  Terminated for unavailable for work.  Thats my prediction.

where do you get your figures that 80 percent of a store would be terminated due to availability and that 275 thousand employees would be fired due to availability neither of those numbers make any sense
80 per store. 80 associates 80 associates x 5500 stores = 275,000
Haha. They absolutely can modify the terms and conditions of your employment.  They have done it for decades.
Read your job offer. Walmart is at will employment.  You have no labor agreement or contract.

depends on the labour standards laws of where you live as well, when i was hired i actually signed a contract tho with wal-mart that outlined exactly what i was being hired for, the hours i was guaranteed, the days i was guaranteed, and they outlined their expectations as well as they told me things after being hired i couldn't do example being piercings etc. when they hire me they hire me as the state i am in at that moment.   And any time they requested me to come in early or for a day shift i refused and quoted my contract i signed and refused and they couldn't do anything
Trust me. You have no contract and no guarantee of anything.  Regardless of what state you are in.
actually i do, and i brought it right to personnel maybe its different where you are dude
I was a store manager for years. You have the same availability form as every other non exempt associate.  You have preferences. Not guarantees.  Dude

So I'm garden center dm. We are working nights for 2 weeks right now setting easter and garden center. Go in last night for night 1. My asm tells me we have a slight problem. Apparently the regional garden center meeting is tomorrow in spokane. This is a yearly mandatory meeting for all garden managers. So have to go in early tonight at 7 instead of 10. Work til about 4, go home and take a nap, and be back by 6:30 to head to the meeting 2 hrs away. Won't be back til about 8 pm. Then back tonight's to finish setting Friday night. I love being garden DM but times like this make me question my sanity.

story: Alicia Miller shared a link to the group: Wal*Mart Associates.
message: http://www.businessinsider.com/warren-buffett-drops-walmart-stock-2017-2
Too big to fail
Can you say GM

Kmart and sears didnt stand a chance. Amazon has high market value but isnt profitable and thus non sustaining.  (Google their profits after cost and overhead) Also they rely heavily on companies to provide their merchandise. Same reason overstock.com isnt the behemoth it was once projected to be.
Berkshire Hathaway knows what it's doing.  Anytime a major shareholder makes a move like this it's not a good sign.
The waltons wipe their asses with his measly 900 mil. No reason to sound any alarms.
You realise warren is worth 95 billion right?
It's 65 billion not 95 do your research
Until Amazon starts accepting ebt cards and selling same day delivery on fresh food,  beer & cigarettes I don't think we have a lot to worry about
You do have a lot of local grocery competition in that area.
We have 2 or 3 other grocery stores in a 50 mile radius but for the most part they are higher in price and don't offer the same amount of stuff that Walmart does.
When your management level on the basement end shows cracks, it's never a good sign. Similar to stacking a pallet off a receiving truck, foundation is the KEY.

Oh but it is a reason to sound the alarms bc his reasoning behind it are valid and many others look to him on the topic of shares. I expect some others to follow suit - and well with doug mcmillons ties to trump... that may even make some big shareholders pull out. a few years a go a couple of large shareholders pulled out based on the companies unfair labor practices. its also not just about the waltons, it affects other shreholders as well..and associates.

As a S2S associate, (no grocery) we don't do a lot of business outside of holidays. Wal*Mart can't compete with Amazon. They sell everything. Let's not overlook the sex industry stuff on Amazon.  They buried Wal*Martin with that income. Then again, I open every package for the customer to verify the contents. That's  a reality show. Still waiting for someone to order a casket though.
Lmao I open every package too that customers receive. But that's policy, so...
Caskets go straight to mortuary.  You won't see it delivered to store
With the way Walmart treat their associates, it's only a matter of time.................................
i think walmart will be the next major retail company to collapse
Ryan Odonnell, the writing is on the wall. But they have been Giants for so long people refuse to read what's on the wall before them!
Carolyn Cat Davis people are sheep. they are attached to walmart
Yes! I have learned this oh so well!
they got too big and greedy... :(
Angela Williamson Lopez yes! They developed the mind set that they are unstoppable!
pfft ;)
Gregory Chambers
Charlie Maroney Bush
Do we get more pto hours added to our pto bank anytime soon?
Nope, you earn them as you work far as I know
Yeah you earn so much a pay period
I thought at the beginning of Walmarts new year they gave you more but I maybe wrong.
Nope..
Nope
You earn them all the time. Nothing is ever added because a certain date on the calendar happens
Next pat period you should see some.
Stupid question for me if I'm working 9.3 hours a day then how many hours total for week??
Depends on ft/pt, how many with company. See the above chart
I'm fulltime
How many years have yout been with us m
14 years I have in
15 in July
Then for every 9.3 hours you work yout earn one hour of pto
You may be earning as a 15 yr associate now. So it should be over 5 hrs a week.
If your earning at 14 yrs,, yes 9.3
At 9.3 should be like 4.30 hrs a week.
If your working 40.
That's what I thought, then like 20 per month, thanks..
Yes always 40
We were supposed to get a grant Feb 1st but it never happened
A grant?

Yes, it's not there anymore but I showed another associate the article and she agreed it meant the same thing. For instance I would have received 21 hrs for working there 8 yrs. A grant would have been nice since I had to use my PTO up to make up for cut hrs.
Never heard of it.
It was there on the Walmart one app. I was going to take a screenshot and post it on here but I forgot.

That grid is what you can earn the year if you dont use it you will see it at the end of the year and they pay out FT over 80 in Feb  and they did. You will never get a lump sum like last year because that was just to start it. we continue earning it from here on out.
Oh thats why people ask about the company giving hours
Does anyone know if they round up total years of experience? I've only been working there since may with 5 years of previous employment, but I'm getting 4 hours of PTO a check.
No, they don't do total years of experience. It's current years of employment.
That's pretty weird then. Because I'm definitely getting more than 2 hours.

Our store got rid of the express lanes. They are all free for all. It's just lovely....especially when they bring a huge cart to a short register and you only have 3 bags and a tiny carousel. üòß

We can't tell them no. I'm not a cashier anymore but it's never been a big deal to me as long as they grab their bags. When it's getting full I just tell them. The only thing that really bugged me is when they put stuff at the end of the counter, especially when I was pregnant and couldn't reach over to grab it.

They don't split. This one lady had a scooter basket overflowing full and came through. She just had a big kids chair on top so you didn't see all the stuff underneath. They had to get a cart after it was bagged. Best part, they people behind them had the look in their eyes like they wanted to complain but couldn't because they had more than 20 also. Not as much. So for the past few days I've either been dipping strawberries or in deli, so I come back to my daily duties of produce today.  So glad to see I'm still the only one who cares about culling and cleaning.

Just wondering does any store on here truly get all the freight from both trucks worked and put away by cap 2. I mean they unload the truck and stock all consumables which includes grocery oh and don't forget all 11 hours of processing
We're still not at 100% at my store but getting close. All grocery is getting done and processing
Mine was really close and some nights we still are but we lost alot of people (due to quiting) and the truck size....And by really close all the grocery paper chemicals infants and pets done
Yea were losing people as well but our main focus seems to be running all of grocery while having somebody in hba and possibly pets
Ours is grocery side first, then infants and pets next...Our third shifts they have people for hba and pharmacy so we don't touch those until the rest of those previous name our done
We do not get all grocery done
We get grocery done 95 ,13,4,
And then drink corner than papre sns chim and some times pets
We can't even keep enough people for all that. We have 8 most nights. If we have just a grocery truck we can get it done by lunch.
We had 2 GM's plus an HVDC tonite. We got 4, 13, and half of 8 and Grocery done. That's with 9 people.
You guys must be super heros or we are majorly doing something wrong!

I was just wondering.. We have an opening on our 3rd shift for support manager and this woman is trying to go for the position but her ex husband (and father of her children) works on our shift. Can she still be eligible for the position?  To me it sounds like a conflict of interest.  Is it considered to be conflict of interest? ???
She's no longer with him? Then it's not a conflict of interest.
Maybe, but they don't have any real authority over anyone, do they?
Overnight supports are over all overnight associates.
The support takes the place of our Asst mngr while he is off cuz we only have 1 on 3rds
Ours aren't really utilizied in a supervisory role at my store.
Our support manager runs the shift 3 days a week so I didn't know if that meant anything

Oh. I almost read that wrong. Gabe Najera is correct if he's her EX there's no conflict.  Elizabeth Turner Marler, overnight Supports are over everyone on nights. They have authority right under the Assistant manager.
Guess you're right. Ours don't really play that much of a supervisory role at my store but I imagine they have that authority if they needed to.

Yeah. Same with ours. They don't seem to have a lot of authority. But one of them is in charge of the Mod Team in addition to whatever else management has them doing. But they do have the authority to give direction to everyone, including me, being a CSM. And they can sit in on evals and coachings.
I'm also a support we are right under the asst managers
Talk to y'all later. I'm at work about to clock in.
Great. .. My shift is s¬©rÔø¶d then... She is so bad no one wants to work with her...
Than you should go for the position
I can't my bf and my younger brother are both on my shift

Idk...it may be her ex, but depending on the age of the children, and whether or not they still need to make decisions on their care or he pays child support or alimony,  I would think it could be seen as a a MAJOR conflict.
I was thinking along those lines too. I am just hoping she gets ruled out in some way.
Good question for Ethics. If I was an SM, I wouldn't feel comfortable allowing it. But I don't know either one of them. Lol
Yeah :) It is nice to have input on it. Cuz Ik its questionable
Read policy.. unless they are romantic inbolved.. no conflict by policy
Well excuse me
Meant that as I've read the policy not for you to read the policy. I've had a situation come up myself that was unsure of a while back.

Jessica, when you get the chance the policy you want to look up is the "Workplace Standards Policy".  You can also find information on this on the Global Ethics website at www.walmartethics.com  See page 15 of the Statement of Ethics.
I'm taking she is in a neighborhood market..... Well overnight support pretty much runs the store when the assistant is off
Who can spot the issues here? Annnnnnd go...ugh lol
It would be quicker to point out what's correct. üòÇ
Haha you're right on that!
Not owning four foot section for many reasons.
Yea if we can break the case absolutely break it and put the rest up. They just decide to put all of it up in one spot instead of taking it to the back or just saying it is unworked.

This is a daily occurrence. There's room at the end so all of the "overstock" goes there. All of that was able to be brought down and had no overstock. I was part of the purge team so I learned from the beginning and had it drilled in my head the right way and the wrong way and if it was wrong we fixed it. I can't just overlook stuff like that.
I understand, it seems it is common  all over. I actually  work  receiving and now have do to top stock  when it is slow.

The main issue I think is training. People aren't being trained the proper way on the rules of top stock. My store manager said it should take a full year for top stock to be 100% right. That can't happen if the rules aren't being followed. When I see someone doing it wrong I politely try to tell them the correct way.

Gretchen Mundrick, I understand  where you are coming  from. I'm  realizing  not only being in receiving  the front is a major  contributer to our shrinkage, we have to be trained correctly to understand what that means to our overall  performance.
You are absolutely correct!
I agree  with  Kris Ceccato
Everything lol
The way the dog food is stacked on the riser. 3high, a bit too high.

The bad part is that when people do stuff like that it makes it to where we aren't as productive because now we have to fix it before we can put anything else up. Yesterday I had to fix and work 12ft of ramen just to put up what I needed to.
is everyone having tops tock issues?.....i get tired of fixing stupid shit on a daily basis.....no one can get on the same page and it drives us crazy
I see you're cap 1 as well. It's annoying. It's a lack of communication in my opinion for management to enforce the rules too everyone. Hell, we have managers fucking it up too.

tell me about it...we get into arguments over it all the time....i finally pulled up one best way or what ever it is on the wire and followed what that says how to do it correctly....cap 2 and overnights are reading a whole different book in general....we go to management about the issues we are finding and they wont do anything about it....

My old store manager was one in a million. He always said any issues were because of 1 of 2 things. Skill or will. Either you don't have the skill to do something or you don't have the will to. You would see these issues disappear if everyone was held accountable for their actions. I know if my manager told me I did something wrong and showed me how to do it the right way and then said the next time it happened I would get coached you bet your butt I would make sure I did it right!
i really love my job, but this shit has got to stop...
I wouldn't say it's top stock issues. I'd say it's more laziness from people who are unwilling to learn, and management who are unwilling to enforce accountability.
Welcome to my world on a daily basis. It's pointless to say anything cause all they do is take a picture like it's a big joke. Nothing will ever be done about it

Looks like someone put the cat food overstock above the dog food. Learn how to top stock
No they didn't do that luckily but I've seen some things before lol they put Nutella on top stock mixed in with the canned vegetables before. I also had oils from department 17 in the baking aisle...
For one what in the world is cardboard doing up on the top stock? Why is cat food n dog food being mixed w eachother? That's just for starters but alot more issues for sure

Dog food and cat food aren't mixed. What's there is all cat food in the one picture and the other picture is for the dog food. Cardboard is up there because it's a case. You can have 3 cases on top stock. I hate seeing full case boxes up on top stock. I think it would look better if everything was taken out of the cases though. It would make it look like it is supposed to be there.
That's the way it is w my store, no cardboard allowed up top at all. If it can be broken down then that's what we do. Ok my bad bout the mix of the two, lol
We can't have any cardboard cases on ours! It looks terrible!
Good grief.

As the department manager over pets in my store, cap team 2 and overnight know better then to even dare touch my top stock lol
Those cases on the shelf is supposed to be laying down not sitting up like it is.

Hate to pull that pallet

Thank you grammar nazi lord. Ill whoop that ass

I was gonna say whoop at ass üòÇüòÇüòÇ
looks safe

STACK IT RIGHT! I deal with this bull on 3rd shift. It barley comes out the bin and one jerk too hard and your entire freight is on thw floor. Embarassing, a waste of my mf timeeee, and just annoying. So, please, dont be THAT guy.

na

Son of a......  and then get the forklift and the rest is history lol

lol apparently someone was thinking I was specifically calling them out or their building. I wasn't but I can guarantee to y'all I keep meticulous records, including text message conversations with shady management that are also screenshot and printed. So if I keep getting played I will be finally sending ALL of the records, and unprofessional stuff I have to the new CEO, including a racial slur from a manager. Guess that's what happens when you crap on a physically disabled as well as neurologically damaged (from a traumatic brain injury)worker. I should have contacted a lawyer years ago that deals with the Americans with disabilities act....... but better late than never üíØ

What's even more entertaining I commented on a former coworkers post earlier about getting injured on his day off, since he was called in which isn't surprising cause they used to do it to me all the time. Then give me crap about overtime. Furthermore since I'm already on a roll a zero craps given at this point. A very main reason there are so many issues in this district are apparently because of the district manager who has pets and favorites that he puts in stores with zero people skills. But it's a damn shame what Mr Sams dream and work has become. I hope I actually do get to talk to Greg Foran but we shall see
Good luck
Sad people have to be mean.
Good morning, is anyone here living  by Kissimmee FL?
Just wanna come visit a Walmart there & see living status
When do they take you off the schedule?
Under what circumstances?
I'm not sure if I'm fired. I haven't gone to work for three days. I'm still scheduled tho. Plus they scheduled me for more days.
Why haven't you gone to work for 3 days? And continue Togo to work. They would tell you if your fired I would think.
Home office was going to let me go because I couldn't be accommodated for what the Dr has said. I want something more then a dr note why I can't work.
Are you ill? Call Sedgwick and file for an loa.
Have you been calling in or just not showing up? How many points do you have.
Are you trying to get fired? If so, why not just tell them you quit?
I didn't want to loose my job, but due to a dr home office was going to have to let me go. No accommodations.
Why not? And what's up with the doc? We'll help you if we can.
You're welcome to pm me if you don't want to discuss it here.
call the manager and see if they work with u
or did they fired u

If you go in they will call you up to the office and have you turn in your stuff and e sign papers stating that you were there or you can call Susan or the other lady in personnel and tell them your going to turn in your stuff. If it's because of medical reason I'd as them to print off a paper stating that no accommodations we going to be made so you can turn that in somewhere.
A week after you leave/quit. It's a pain in the ass too. Nobody to cover that shift.
Probably fired now if u havent showed up in 3 days. Usually 3 weeks till youre off schedule or they can remove you from those days by hand

Our whole store is eliminating the yellow shelf labels & converting to grocery labels. I'm dm of cosmetics.  I think this is ridiculous for my dept. The labels don't fit in my makeup covers. Any other store doing this too?
Every store. It's company wide. Nhms, 2.0s, and gad stations as well
Yes!! It doesn't make sense to have the price on the label twice on the gm side and the item description and upc are so small smh
Doesn't fit in my freezer doors very well either. Especially with the plastic covers I have to use.
Ours. And I hate it. You have to squint to see the category and section numbers
It's not grocery labels, it's the new uniform label...  I think it's silly, but hey is Walmart
Sooner or later. Those new universal labels will have a price per inch for the televisions lol
Hey, on some of the items it's REALLY helpful. People can compare cost per ounce savings on different sizes of body wash without whipping out their phone
It does make sense for some departments. I like to know what the price comes down to per ounce to see if it's worth buying bigger bottles or what not
If you print them off the handheld printer they will fit
I agree that the upc, description and item location is very difficult to see.
Yes. I am Dm in cosmetics also. They are too big and I have a hard time seeing upc numbers and location.

What everyone can do when your store manager go to the year beginning meeting they always ask the department managers things that need to be done and so on. Make a suggestion that we go back to the regular labels.
One Best Way
Shoot, after changing them all to the new stupid label, we might as well keep them and not create more work by switching back.  üòÇ
I think the company doesn't want the added expense of buying yellow shelf/sticky labels. They just the whole company to use the same label. Just my speculation
One best way
We all are!
Print the mod labels in the old uom format. They still fit and look better

And then have to replace them all again when they are not correct.. unfortunately it's not an optional program... it really sucks on the fresh meat wall when the plu is microscopic... but it is what it is
I think he's referring to the old labels in the cosmetic bull nose.  I hoarded a bunch of old labels for this reason, until they come up with a new way to price cosmetics for the customers.
Yes, its tacky...they don't fit in peg covers...
I am temporary dept of 46 and omg it looks so wrong especially since we don't have the portable labels like the new ones it'll look stupid and will even when we get the new portable labels üòë
Our store is in the process of converting too. I think it looks crazy, like it's too much to take in at once, especially in the more crowded areas like cosmetics
Hope they are easier to read!  Some of they labels I've seen its so hard to read
They are much harder to read all the numbers and lettering is smaller
I don't like them hard to see the upc everything is small.
I feel the same way, plus they are a lot harder to read.
Too small for average person to read as customer. Literally have to remove it to read it.

If I hear 'one best way' as the response to everything that isn't working, I will scream.   One Best Way had to come from folks that have never worked in a real store, with real associates, customers and managers.  I would love to be a test store for some of this stuff that comes down to us.  LIke, are you serious?They don't listen to what people are actually telling them or the associates are only telling them what they want to hear.
Being a test store sucks, I speak from experience seeing as how my store is one,..
I would love to have lunch with you so you could share how it really works!
I'm a stocker and some of the labels are impossible to read!
I have them in shoes.  I don't care for them, but after replacing them all, I sure don't want to do it again!  üò≤
Doesn't matter if it makes sense.just do it.Geez.
We all are
All stores are converting to these labels
The direction was to just set as we changed mods and price changes. They didn't want us resetting all mods üòµ
We all will have the SAME label now. No more looking for others. And I figure they will "twerk" some things. No one likes change, but this is minimal compared to other things
We just rolled that out in our store. I'm DM of jewelry and men's wear. I just changed my labels and personally I love them.
Yup. They look stupid in electronics too.
I've on been setting new release so far
Electronics here. They look really stupid with the double price. Redundant.
Make modular locations hard to see. It's  just pointless. Haha.
Most likely company wide.
Yes our store its stupid
I work meat DM and they are replacing the tan labels for the fresh meat with them and they suck can't see the plu #
Overnight

yep our store is doing the same thing. I am DM of OTC and I do not like them ether

They do I don't like them at all what genius came up with that

That's what I asked, they said use the labels I said we might as well stick with the old labels then until we get the new labels in for the portable printer otherwise it looks stupid lol
It does look stupid
It's very dum...and hard to read,numbers &letters so small,us OLDER folks with bad eyes very hard to see to read
Yes, it's company wide!

Sometimes they don't think these things thru..

ARE THERE ANY STORE OUT THERE WHO ARE ALREADY ON THE NEW CUSTOMER FIRST SYSTEM?
Yes, my store is on it and we piloted it when it first launched over a year ago
No- not really.   It's based on the availability of the associate and the demand of the customer

In my experience, then yes it would go in seniority- but I have seen brand new PT cashiers get 33 hours with open availability while FT cashiers with closed availability or less open (like 8-430) gets 18 hours   You don't have to have open availability you just need to have enough availability to where it will generate you a shift  Like 6a-7p would generate multiple shift options

No that's not true   There is an option for you and your manager to agree on a set schedule and the system will write that schedule. That's for those positions that have specific times that are needed:  some examples-  Overnight stocker could agree to 10-7 with same days off- so they do a "fixed shift" which allows system to write schedule each week  Another could be the baker in bakery who usually works 5-2  Or accounting etc....   Those positions that are already a specific shift

You wouldn't get the shifts- because your availability is not within the demand it calls for  But- store manager- can do a fixed shift- for a short time to accommodate- but it would need to be for a short time- because it would throw off the accuracy
You're very welcome :)
So Tara im very concerned about my days off. I want to know with the new system can you request specific days off or the system generate them?
What does this mean
Basically if you don't have open availability you get the remaining hours left. If you have open availability you won't notice a difference.
But I call lies cause I have open availability and my hours dropped drastically.
Same here i went from gettimg 5 days a week to just 3

Don't put open 24 hours- that won't generate any hours for some reason  You need to write down you actual availability   Like 6a- 7p would generate shifts   I've been on it for over a year and we have been working out the kinks

What exactly is this Customer First thing with scheduling? I haven't heard of this in my store yet...
It's where corporate does the schedules to suit the store better,

It's scheduling geared around when there are peak hours of business.  More associates scheduled when there's more customers and less associates are scheduled when less associates.  It seems though when there's more customers there not enough associates to assist the customers.

Agreed...and.then when customers get ticked because they are waiting or can't get help....then our cff  scores go down and it will be the associates fault....stills scratching my head on this to figure out the concept
Yeah I'll go in on my regular schedule 10pm-7am and have them fix it.

Well i know what it is supposed to be but......what it really is.......they don't schedule enough people in the store to take care of customers.  From what I see it isn't customer first it definitely isn't associates first it is corporate pockets first.  The way they are staffing the stores it is just another way to cut down on hours.
